text:
Hi people, I am trying to schedule a blog post through the API, but I get the: `publishDate must be in the future` error.
But if I go and edit the blog post through the CMS, I can do it.

So far I have found out that using the web UI, you can’t schedule web pages and landing pages to be published in the past, but you can with Blog posts.
But through the API it seems like it is not possible.

Any help would be appreciated!

Hi People,

I'm trying to add a calling extension in HubSpot. But confused with the API endpoint. Can you help me with this?

Ok so I don’t think the V1 endpoint I mentioned earlier will be able to update associated labels. I’m now using */crm/v4/associations/{fromObjectType}/{toObjectType}/labels* 

Unfortunately now I’m getting the below:
`{`
    `"status": "error",`
    `"message": "Unable to infer object type from: 15693151622",`
    `"correlationId": "3cb38eca-7fc8-435b-86ca-053d36f64b8c"`
`}`

Does anyone know a why I might be seeing this or is there a different approach I need to take here. I have the association labels created in my account under settings/objects/associations but I cant seem to set them via the api when creating a new deal and its *assotiations via crm-associations/v1/associations/create-batch.* 

Any response to this is welcome

Hi team, anybody else getting error with trying to use oauth with any user that doesn't have "app marketplace access" permissions (even with apps that are not in the marketplace)? This was working perfectly fine until today.
Is there a way to export tracking url builder urls?

is this purely for the purpose of having accurate publish dates displayed on published blogs on your site? If yes, simply publishing using: `PATCH` request to the `<http://api.HubSpot.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts/{objectId}|api.HubSpot.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts/{objectId}>` endpoint, including the desired published date (which you should be able to set in the past), will likely get you what you’re looking for.

If that doesn’t suit the use case, I’d be interested to learn more about what you’re trying to do.
